div.head: To the Reader.
div.p: I Know (Gentle Reader) that Custome commands an Epistle to thee, for Fauourable Acceptance, and honest Entertainment of such a great Labour. But I am (at this time) forced to Write vnto thee, both on the behalfe of my selfe and the Printer: in regard of many Escapes, which vsually chanceth in Printing, by reason, that immediately after the Bookes beginning, sicknesse & other infirmities, did bereaue him of his sight. If therefore any thing do or may appeare offensiue, either in Method or Matter, I would not haue thee displeased in any thing whatsoeuer, or that any Argument thorough the whole Booke, should be (in the least degree) preiudiciall to thee. Therefore, accept it with like Loue and Kindnesse, as it is sent vnto thee, in Honest Affection and Friendlinesse.
